description:
I don't eat at Chipotle, but today I ate at Chipotle. 

I ordered a veggie bowl with white rice, black beans, hot salsa, guacamole and lettuce. Overall it was standard and satisfying enough - the salsa was perfectly spicy, I will say. 

Staff was friendly but the restaurant itself could be cleaner and their soda machine had no carbonation. The guy at the register gave me a heads up on the carb, but didn't say why or if it was being fixed? A bit odd and disappointing since I was craving a soda, but the lemonade came out just fine. 

I'll never go out of my way to eat here - or at any Chipotle for that matter - but I wouldn't be too upset about another quick meal here. That said the prices are egregious ($11.50 for a bowl and soda, no meat) and I could get way better Mexican food for less virtually anywhere in the city.
author: Alex K.

description: Didn't taste like the chipotle I usually get. Their guacamole didn't have the taste I am used to getting. The table wasn't clean also.
author: Avi K.

description: Stopped by here to get dinner for my kid. We ordered the build your own with chicken.  The food was good but only realized later when we went to another Chipotle that we get two toppings. Three girl serving is didn't ask what we wanted our second topping to be. Other than that, it tasted like standard Chipotle food. We also got a fruit (clementine) and milk with the meal.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Half of the items were gone at dinner time (7pm). Your bowl would come out half empty. But you still pay the same price. Asked if they could fill it up with existing items. The lady shouted at me rudely. 
Oh btw everything was cold.
author: Jenny J.

description: This location made my order wrong, which happens, but the manager on duty was incredibly rude to me and dismissive of my time. Very rude, slow staff, they don't care about customer service and I assume that Chipotle as a  company doesn't care either.
author: Jason V.

description: These guys could not be bothered to open up on time. We stood outside for half of our lunch break waiting for them to open. 20 minutes we waisted , then we went elsewhere.
author: Melissa P.

description: I went to this location during open hours and the doors were locked. Bummed because I was really craving Chipotle.
author: Daniel R.

description: I really disappointed by a server , kind of looks like Chinese white mix girl ,  she served  exactly opposite food that I requested ,I requested 2 orders of rice bowl , I told her to give both , brown and white rice , but she put only white rice , I again requested then she put brown rice too , then I told her to put just tiny little bit of mild tomato salsa but she put the whole scoop of that , she was not willing to listen my request , I was totally disappointed with her service and she look kind of unhappy while serving, I felt insulted .
author: Subash C.

description: Feels like you're in the tenderloin. If you're with your family or children go to another location. Nice people, lazy management, really dirty location.
author: Alex W.

description: This one I blame solely on the management. They are constantly out of supplies, the dinning room is always dirty and the staff isn't very friendly. They didn't open until 12pm the last two days because of "no supplies" or lettuce!
author: Jason H.

description: Are there yesterday. The service was unusually slow for a Chipotle. Several of the usual ingredients were unavailable. Trash was overflowing out of the bins.
author: Jack M.

description: This is a SUPER busy location near union square so expect a fully packed place during the lunch and dinner hours. The staff at this location are really patient and helpful considering how many tourists and first-time chipotle customers dine here. They comped my meal when the to-go bag broke outside on the sidewalk. The queso is always hot and the food is consistently fresh and delicious. FYI 90% of the menu is gluten-free.
author: Sarah N.

description: Stopped by here starving just before closing time the poor staff was standing there having to tell people that they were out of things I just took what they had left because I was so hungry. They were so friendly and amazing it was probably my best Chipotle experience ever as far as staff goes!!! Great job guys!!!!
author: Lisa A.

description: I am definitely not a person that complains at all. I felt it was important to warn people of this place. To many people,places and things in this world today are not right! Things need to start changing. This is the WORST chipotle ever !!!! Do not go! I have been there at least 10 times out of convenience only , every time they are out of at least 1-3 things . Service is horrible, rude, Dirty , dismissive, and they can't cook rice!, I could go on. Food also tastes different from other locations. Different not in a good way. Stay away. You're better off going to Walgreens around the corner. No Joke!
author: Bryant H.

description: Employees eat, leave a bit of a mess and don't wipe down the table?  Not much pride in the workplace and leaves me questioning how much attention is given to other things.  Also ran out of steak and a other main.  Not planning either.
author: Eric B.

description:
This location continues to be dirty and has quite a few staff that don't seem concerned with helping clients. The location is near my office and I have gone multiple times (weekdays) over the last few months- usually at different times weekdays between 1:30 and 4:30 pm. The tables are always very dirty, the restaurant only half full and the staff of 6-8 employees are rarely behind the counter (usually seem to be in the back talking). Schedule extra time if you come here- there may be only 1-2 people in line, but there only 1-2 people behind the counter making food- the rest seem to be continually in the back.
Or- save time. There's another location a few blocks away on Kearny that's cleaner and you get your food (much) quicker.
author: nick w.

description: Busy busy chipotle, long line. Waited 15 mins for my order, was worth it though. Always a fan of chipotle. This is the closest one to me. Friendly workers.
author: Nicole C.

description: I usually order bowl with extra avocado. The meat they use sometimes are not fresh. So be cautious. Also adding rice is not a good idea.
author: Chun J.

description: The lady who is tasked to bill behind the counter Monday 9pm 18 December has been stereotyped. Sadly she is rude, has zero customer service and simply should not be working for Chipotle. They need better staff than this and she was rude and unhelpful I'll never return.
author: Bert K.

description: The food is consistently reliable at this Chipotle location. What actually keeps me coming back is the always fantastic customer service! Special mention should go to Josh and Vanessa. They go above and beyond making me feel valued as a regular customer. Therefore, even when I'm several blocks away and closer to another Chipotle in the downtown area, I usually take the extra time to walk to this particular location. Actually, the entire staff is very friendly and helpful, but I cannot remember all of their names. Keep it up everyone and thank you very much!  :)
author: Peter C.

description: This location has hours posted to open at 10:45am daily.  More than once this location has opened late.  Today was the worst.   I came at 10:50am to see two people waiting outside the door.  I joined them in seeing 2 workers behind the counter preparing while one worker was at a table eating.   We knocked on the door and no worker even looked our way.  They finally opened the doors at 11:02am.  One of the men waiting with me walked straight to the counter to ask why they opened late and why they couldn't let us wait inside.  Instead of apologize, the worker named Jazmine who was not at the counter demanded, "What did you say?!  What do you want?!"  The man repeated that they should open on time.  Jazmine walked away to the other end of dining room but yelled, "We're short!  We can't let you in till we're ready!  What do you want me to say?!  You don't like it, you can go somewhere else!"  Jazmine never apologized.  What was worse, a DinerDash guy came in, cut in front of me and waived his phone showing his pickup order.  They immediately started making his order, even though I had been waiting the whole time.  I exclaimed, "I've been waiting and you make HIS order before mine!"  Jazmine again yelled something that was not an apology.   I understand things happen and many businesses are cutting back, but Jazmine should have simply apologized and not make customers feel like it was our fault.
author: Wendel T.

description: I like chipotle a lot. When it comes to this particular location I hate it a lot. The workers are very rude and have their heads up their butts. They don't understand clear instructions and are very impatient when it comes to handling customers. I do not recommend wasting your time at this location. It is worth it to drive to another.
author: Alyssa A.

description: OK first let me explain that the day before we could eat here we went to Mission District and had killer Mexican food. I'm sure if I ate here before I would have given this place a better rating however compared to what I had the previous day this place was just OK. Everybody seems to rave about the burrito bowl and I think it was average. However the staff and the atmosphere was great.
author: Marcus S.

description:
Chipotle, for me at least, has never been about anything other than the food. The food is consistently fresh and tasty. You don't go to McDonalds for the atmosphere, and that applies to Chipotle as well. 

What I like about my few experiences at this Chipotle is they have always piled the ingredients high. I'm a big man with a big appetite and nothing irks me more than to order a burrito bowl and gets scoops half the size of my regular franchise location. Here, they exceed my scoop expectations, meaning I don't have to double down on meat while ignoring awkward glances from the no-meat, no-rice, no-sour-cream-no-cheese, no-anything-tasty vegetarian behind me. 

The atmosphere, as I mentioned, leaves much to be desired. It's a small place and being in downtown SF usually means crowds. Each time I've come I've had to grab a table at butt level with someone at a higher bench. Not the best view, and not the best dining experience when you're worried about bean farts while you eat your meal.
author: Alex L.

description: No veggies. Was told they just don't have them. Rude and dismissive staff. The short change you on guac and very unhelpful manager on duty at 5.30pm June 8th. A disgrace to the chipotle name.
author: John G.

description: Affordable prices for big size portions of very tasty and succulent burritos, tacos, quesadillas and yummy tortillas with Cheese dip!
author: Roderick G.

description: I had the best vegan bowl at this location today! The customer service was excellent. I even got fresh lemons for my ice tea...shout out to Diamanté, he went above and beyond the call of duty!!
author: Gloria H.

description: This is the last time that I will waste $4 dollars to park only to walk into this establishment and them be out of something that I want, the first time it was guacamole, this time it was the hard shell tortilla. 2 times in row!!  Ugh! Done!! Such a waste of time!!
author: Marquez C.

description: I'm usually trustful of Chipotle's consistency and freshness. This time I'm not so sure. Not sure what it is about Union Square and the adjacent tenderloin that attracts some of the biggest ripoffs and laziest workers in the restaurant industry. I ordered a burrito bowl and am 90% sure it's what gave me a mild case of food poisoning. My stomach wasn't the same the rest of my trip. Within 2-3 hours of me eating the food, I was extremely nauseous and my colleagues said I looked white as a ghost. I can thank you for having to skip a half-day of conference due to your lazy food handling practices.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I paid $24 for 1 burrito and 1 salad. The salad didn't even fill the container all the way and they charged me $2.50 for a single scoop of guacamole! What a rip off. They also tried to rush everyone in line which wasn't even that long. I understand if you have like 5+ people waiting but if you have 2 people you should take your time and try and work on your customer service skills... One guy got mad at me because I said regular beans instead of pinto beans. Also, we ordered our food to-go and they didn't even give me a fork or any napkins. I probably won't eat at a Chipotle ever again. Waste of money. 

I just wanted to add that my chicken was really cold along with my brothers beans in his burrito. I ended up picking out all the chicken because it was extremely fatty and it grossed me out...
author: Justine C.

description:
So I got a burrito at six right before an event I was attending. This order was a to-go order, so I didn't eat it until I got to the event 10 minutes later. My first bite was crunchy. And so we're the next few bites. They had undercooked the rice, so I stopped eating it and thought I'd go back for another one at the end of the event. 

Two hours later I was starving as I walked to the restaurant. I got another burrito free of charge and guessed what? The rice was still crunchy. My guess is that they have been undercooking the rice all day at that location. 

I go to Chipotle for good food. If I wanted to eat bad food, I would just prepare it myself because cooking is one skill I know that I lack.

So to the manager: This issue of undercooked rice needs to be addressed!
author: Kevin C.

description: This is now of the worst Chipotle's I have EVER been to and I have been to many all over the country. They ALWAY run out of something whether its guac or quest dip or veggies hours before closing. The other day I went in at 8:30pm, they close at 10pm and they were out of veggies. I asked if they were going to make more and they would not. This happens on a regular basis. Its not like I am going in there with minutes to spare, I go in over an hour before closing so everything should be available. The food was bland last time as well. This store is a SUPER hight traffic store so you would think they would be able to get it together by now. Very disappointed.
author: Nicole A.

description: If anything I go to Chipotle for the food, I can't say the service is the best. We wanted ice tea, but they ran out. We asked one of the staff and he told us bad luck, they ran out. After insisting he asked the cashier, who told him that there was more in the back. After some minutes he came back and continued cleaning, we asked him and he told us to talk to the cashier. We ended up taking another drink instead.
author: Erik S.

description: Went here after a long day of travel to get a quick and easy to eat meal. I ordered tacos that literally ended up being a pile of food when I got home.  It was very messy. One of the tacos only had rice in it and was piled on top of the remainder of the ingredients. One of the shells did not actually have any food in it, it was just on the side. The chips were also bstale.  Not impressed with this chipotle.
author: Claire B.

description: Great place and great service. Quick too for being overcrowded with customers. I usually go there for lunch because it's really fast service.
author: Stephen M.

description: The place was a mess. The lobby area was not kept up. The food was a bit old (the chips were definitely old) and the servers were not experienced, I mean, how long does it take to learn how to wrap up a burrito? Also, they were 30 mins from closing and they were training someone on cleaning the equipment as opposed to serving the long line of clients = need better customer-focused culture.
author: Ricardo G.

description: I went to buy a tacos with my friend. All the staff was nice and friendly. But with the manager   Nick Toribio jump to help. He was very Ruth with my friend.  And mean guy. We was very sad the way how he treat  us. I was very disappoint  about that place. I'm sure will never back to eat there. Chipotle sure higer very manager and not cheap labor.  Employees who they not know how to treat very the community.
author: Enrique V.

description: Went in to get some good food since I have only experienced good food at all the other chipotles I've ate at but this one not so great. Walked in at about 930pm and they close at 10 and ordered two bowls. Well to start off the food they had, not much, was cold already once we tasted it. Didn't even bother to finish it after sitting down to eat real quick. What made it worst is that the employees serving the food were doing everything real quick like if they had a line of 20 people waiting and to top it off the cashier had the biggest attitude when charging me. She charged me and gave me back my change and walked away when I was asking her a question. Well I could go on and on but the WORST EVER EXPERIENCE AT CHIPOTLE. Definitely not visiting this one again.
author: Neri G.

description:
it is pretty empty today, so they can keep yelling in the back, and play loud music with your phone when there is other music playing with their over head speakers made it very very annoying.

I will make sure I make it to-go next time so I don't have to listen to all that crap.

nothing has improved since my last visit, all the loud music and yelling in the back is really annoying. the whole team looks very unfocused and lack of principles.
author: Zack Y.

description:
Went there 3 days ago, took a burrito with chicken. Really not bad: quick, cheap, tasty.
Only comment from my side: it is not always clear, what is included and what counts as an extra: they tell you: avocado? And if you say yes, then: OK, but 2 dollars more.
author: Alex G.

description: This Chipotle location is very accommodating to their customers, and has quick service. The workers are very friendly too! Especially this one person.. by the name of Brandon? He was very sweet, and wrapped my burrito very well :)
author: Alex Y.

description: The staff is lovely and professional.  The food is a bland, tasteless, flavorless mess.  I tried to eat this wreck of a bowl, but even with extra salsa it was just awful.  After a few bites, I returned to the cashier and told them,  they were professional enough to credit me for this horrible corporate food.  Chipotle's wondering why they have no customers, It's the FOOD.
author: EC N.

description:
When I don't have time, and basically is a walk away from anywhere you might be a cheap and healthy. ^^ 

The service was average, but still good for the amount of customers they have at noon. 
As well as a one-to-one questions of the service provided, they will do anything to help out  :)
author: Tatiana P.

description: I came to eat here today after my meeting for a quick bite and I usually love this place. Everyone is usually very nice and friendly. However, they had a new girl on the line and she just looked like she hated her job. On top of that, my rice was very soggy, so much so that it created clumps of rice balls.
author: Diana N.

description:
Zero grams of regret. 

Only because it's Friday.
author: Janice C.

description:
No bowls to make a salad in, so you had to make ours in an upside-down lid?

No salad-cut lettuce, so you had to jump to the end of the assembly line and grab taco-cut lettuce (the thin strips used on the top of the salad) and then double back to the start of the line?

No forks, forcing us to take it to-go back to the hotel where we could beg the hotel restaurant for one?

No way to properly seal two lids together, forcing us to put it in a bag (and incur the state-mandated bag fee) to carry it away?

No working Mr. Pibb on the fountain? (which we would have ordered if we had dined there, which we couldn't do without a fork to eat our salad with... Unsure if it was out of syrup or broken...)

No bueno, Chipotle...

Several other issues with other customers left us in a non-Chipotle-esque slow-moving 20+ minute line at 9:15pm. Wife ultimately did enjoy her salad, so one star for that.  And I'm probably to blame by not having a gluten-free backup plan when the wife took a late nap and most places were closed or closing at 9.  At least she got something to eat....

1.19 stars.
author: Joe C.

description: I love this location its my favorite one its not too packed and the staff is always friendly and gives me what i like. i love Chipotle  its my favorite place to eat.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Well kids, in a 9-11 like twist the service at Chipotle went even further down hill. There was a time, a beautiful 2 weeks, where the service felt average. Almost expected, even. Alas, when there was barely 7 people in the restaurant and 5 workers behind the glass, not one word was mentioned in a greeting. Not a "Hello, I'll be right with you!" Just rude stares of "why are you here?" And "Look at my back. Now look at my co-workers back. Now look at both our backs while we're not facing the doorway." 

Ah yes, on one hand it's good to be back in good ol' Chipotle. On the other hand, it'd be nice to eat my burrito without questioning what I did, from walking in to walking up to the counter, to deserve to be treated so rudely. 

0/10, I don't recommend this place. But I also don't think they'll change. For all of it's hippieness, Chipotle is still a mainstream American chain restaurant, grounded in conservative financial values.
author: Cody R.

description: Ordered online - came to the store and my food still wasn't ready. Then the guy completely screwed up my order. When I got home I called looking for a refund and they told me they couldn't unless I was physically in the store. The place is constantly understaffed and the people who do work there are incompetent. Last time I ever spend money there.
author: Andy J.

description: Untrained staff, messed up something as simple as a chicken taco. I am at a loss for words. Eaten at many Chipotle, this one bottom of the pile in terms of service. Terrible!
author: Shamal N.

description: Chipotle O'Farrell, get your sh*t together.  I postmated burritos and bowls from O'Farrell multiple times and came away with tiny portions that were made up of 50% rice.  I'll be using the Sutter location from now on.
author: Brent H.

description: I order last night a steak bowl to go it taste ok ,But around two to tree hours  I star w/ nauseas and I vomited 3 times during all night, reading others review with similar complaints I thing the health department need to made an inspection off this place, and check how the food it's handle, prepare and keep it , some off the employees definitely not doing the right thing a lot  off people are getting food poison from this location , not going back there ever
author: Morena H.

description: My wife had the barbacoa beef bowl last night at 930 pm, started feeling nauseous at 300am, and started vomiting at 630am.... has been off and on since.  I can't confirm food poisoning, however we. Other are the same thing all day with the exception of chipotle.... I wasn't hungry.  Our last day in SAN Francisco has been spent in a dimly lit hotel room with her getting up to vomit all day.  Never again chipotle....... never.
author: Laurence H.

description: Was looking for a quick place to grab dinner in the area and happened to find a familiar Chipotle in a sea of unknowns. Food was good as usual but please tell the staff to take a chill pill. I pointed to something over the glass wall and the person reacted like I had sneezed into the food or stolen something. I am OK with you pointing it out but no reason to be rude. Chill dude, I am a bigger germaphobe than you.
author: Sunil R.

description: The attitude of the serve was horrible. She asked what I wanted so I said rice. In the end, she told me she has to charge extra because taco doesn't come with rice. I said that we would appreciate she told me before she add it on. Then, her attitude was horrible and she dropped the plate heavily on front of me. It was crazy! If it's not because of the food is consistent good, I will never come again. I have to say that the casher was smart though. The casher saw it and said that the drink is free for me to apologize for that.
author: Anya C.

description: Hungry? Looking for quick service during transition periods? Stop by chipotle off ofarrell  and experience excellent service from Jazmine, Corinna and Paul in the back cookin that good good. They got bars all day
author: Rob R.

description: Foods fine but today i saw some unsanitary kitchen practices. A guy in street clothes, was eating eating burrito a burito and cooking food for customers in the kitchen area. Then i saw another person eating a burrito in the kitchen. Employees and manager didnt seem to care. I am not amused by this at all.
author: Kristan B.

description:
Visited for lunch.

Typical mexicana fast food place. Step up to the counter,, order what you want (burrito, bowl, etc), pick your meat, rice (brown or white), pick a bean (black or pinto), pick you condiments (salsa, cheese, lettuce, corn, etc) and then pay.

Lunch for two...which were two burritos and two pops came to $19.25....cheaper than a similar restaurant at home (Mucho Burrito).

Food is tasty and will do the job. I had the hot salsa and it left a mild tingle on my lips....so it wasn't too spicy at all.
author: Jim B.

description: Poor quality and experience with tiny steak salad for $8. Found 2 large slices of romaine stem at the bottom of my salad.  Manager explained how they cut the romaine all the way to the bottom and usually takes out the stems. Obviously, this is being overlooked. Manager was nice enough to offer refund cuz I won't dine Chipotle again.
author: Thomas W.

description:
Hands down the worst Chipotle I've ever been to. Maybe the worst fast-casual dining experience I've ever had. Mostly because it wasn't fast in any sense of the word. It's like the employees are just all hanging out and maybe they'll make you some food if you're lucky. The lack of speed with which the people move there is incredible. So that's my chief concern with this Chipotle location.

Secondary concern was food quality. I went in around 1 pm on a Saturday and they were scraping the bottom of every pan. Come on guys. You know when your lunch rush is. Prepare for it.

Really taken aback by the total disregard for customer experience here. Will not visit a Chipotle again for a while.
author: Kate B.

description:
Didn't really enjoy my burrito maker here. The initial tortilla-rice-beans guy was fine, but the mea-salsas-extras guy was sooo surly. 

I was ordering for three people to bring food home and I asked him which salsa was the tomatillo one. He proceeded to dump the hot red one on the burrito. Knowing what I know of salsas and my friends taste, I figured the red one would be too spicy and that tomatillo salsa should be green. Turns out both the hot and mild salsa are made with tomatillos. Why didn't he ask for clarification if they both had tomatillos???

I don't handle spicy food well at all and I know how quickly too much spicy salsa can ruin an entire burrito so I asked him to remake it. The huffiness he gave was just crazy. I wasn't rude, I apologized, I said please. I don't think it merited such attitude. 

Plus, this store was pretty skimpy on all the portions, but I've been noticing that in a lot of chipotles recently so maybe it's just the company's way of dealing with rising wages/food prices.
author: Jamie S.

description: Mehhhh, not the best chipotle with the freshest ingredients. I like the one in Davis the best!
author: Shalini P.

description: I would usually think all Chipotles are relatively the same, but I especially like coming to this location! The staff is always so nice and quick to get the line moving at a fast pace! They keep the inside very clean which is great I don't have to wipe away the person who sat before me's lettuce and rice! The ingredients are always fresh and hot too. Will be back!
author: Hoku L.

description: Being laughed at for being transgender isn't what Id call good customer service. Stop hired children with bad customer service skills.
author: Nani Y.

description: This place was fine until today when I got food poisoning. It's been popping up on chipotles across the NW for months and has made its way to CA. I called to notify the store and the manager couldn't care less. He was obviously offended claiming the store was kept very clean when the ecoli breakout is said to come from the produce not the facilities. http://www.wkyc.com/story/news/local/northeast-ohio/2015/11/20/chipotle-e-coli-outbreak-hits-ohio/76127346/
author: Samantha L.

description:
Love Chipotle!

How much do I live this place?  Enough to eat here every day I stayed in San Francisco.  The ingredients were fresh and delicious.  I never had such a clean and fresh tasting burrito.  The flavors are great!  I either get the bowl or the burrito.  

I did not have a problem with service like I hear from others.  Service isn't a big deal since it's a cafeteria style with the other thing you need to do is tell the what you want in it.  

The price is cheap too!
author: Reid A.

description: This is the kind of place where you know food is not going to be the greatest but you also know that it won't be bad either. This place will certainly fill up your appetite, especially with any of the Burritos that they serve. There's plenty of different spicy sauces and nacho chips you can buy on the side that are great! I never get much in my burrito as I am extremely picky but this particular location made me the biggest burrito ever and it was great! This place is always crowded, I normally just order my food and pick it up at the register. The workers are nice, the service is fast, and the food is terrific! Skip the trip to Mexico, it is all at Chipotle!
author: Matilda B.

description:
I get personally uncomfortable when I come to this Chipotle. The manager is aggressive, trite, pressuring, and unpleasant when working the preparation line. I felt rushed and ultimately didn't get what I wanted because of her attitude and management style. It's my lunch break and I want to enjoy it - please be more polite to your customers. The manager's lack of basic customer service makes me reluctant to come back. That was the first -2 stars. 

The other two stars were because she is also incredibly harsh on her employees, who are doing their best to not make any mistakes with her breathing over their shoulders. I don't want to eat somewhere that doesn't respect employees as real people trying to earn a living. 

Less stick and more carrot on behalf of the manager would make me change my review. Until then, I would avoid this Chipotle unless you enjoy feeling rushed, pressured, and stressed during your lunch break.
author: Joel A.

description: Food is not wow but ok. It's a nice place to sit.
author: Annelies B.

description:
How wonderful to have a chipotle in the middle of the city! It is close to union square but still in the financial district. 
The staff was nice enough. 
The one annoying thing was the seating. It didn't seem like they had enough seating for how busy the place was. I think there was some upstairs seating but it wasn't easy to notice.
author: Cara C.

description: Worst chipotle around. My burrito looked child size. SMH. I look around and everyone has huge burritos. Maybe it was beacuse im black.
author: Edgar B.

description: I've been to better Chipotles. The food was not as tasty as usual, and despite the place being empty, the employees seemed to be in a rush.
author: Lucas C.

description:
I watched the lady rolling the burritos decimate 4 burritos before mine. When it came time to roll mine, it tore in the middle so she transplanted it to a new tortilla and then tore that one but just gave it to me. Manager looked at me and said "sorry for the wait" without so much as offering a free drink.

One of these stars is simply for being a chipotle.
author: A. Wolfram K.

description: I have been working in the Union Square area for just about 3 years now and have been to this Chipotle many many times. Being at work I am always in a hurry and often order online. Although the food and place are excellent the "Pick up" process could be revamped a little. I do see that they have a  "Pick Up" Window however have never seen it actually being used. You end up having to cut in front of a large line of people that are far from stoked about you doing so. This is not the fault of any of the employees, just the way things seem to be ran  Any ideas Chipotle?
author: Bryce O.

description:
They definitely live up to their name. Went in around 730 ish on a weekday night - the lineup wasn't bad, they were friendly, and the food tastes amazing as always. I always get a bowl because 1. it's easier to eat out of a bowl, 2. it's less messy, 3. I can't confirm this, but the amount of food you get is slightly more than a taco or burrito. 

While I was paying, the cashier put in the wrong order, but he just let it go. Saved me 50 cents :)
author: Elisa L.

description:
I usually love chipotle, but this is the WORST Chipotle I've ever been to.

My husband and I both ordered chicken burritos.  There was really only enough chicken in the container for one burrito.  The woman who was making our burritos didn't feel like taking the effort to get a fresh batch, so she scraped everything she could get out of the bottom of the container and split it between our two burritos. This was about half a spoon of meat per burrito, so there was barely any meat.  Since I didn't get a full portion of meat, the ratios were messed up and the salsa and sour cream had nothing to mix in with.  This resulted in a cold soggy burrito that was falling apart the whole time I was eating it.  Yuck.

The staff needs some training on how to serve a consistent chipotle product with appropriate portion sizes, so they can better meet customer expectations.
author: Kelly F.

description:
What is up with these people who feel the need to reach over the tall glass divider to point at the ingredients they want?  Just look at the menu and speak the ingredients ... chicken, black beans, mild salsa, corn.  Alternatively, just point at the ingredient from the customer side.  The server should be able to connect the imaginary line between your finger and the desired ingredient.  Chipotle should take a cue from Subway.  Subway's massive glass divider is only slightly less effective than a moat with crocodiles.

That being said, I'm a big fan of Chipotle.  The food is good and it's relatively cheap.  Ingredients are always fresh.  Sometimes the chicken is a bit too charred for my taste, but better charred than undercooked.  The steak is usually too chewy so I avoid it for the most part.  The carnitas (braised pork) is pretty good: lean but not too dry.  And, don't knock the sofritas (braised tofu) until you try it.  It actually does a decent job of simulating the taste and consistency of ground meat.  And, last but not least ... chips and guacamole.  The chips are sometimes a bit too salty, but the guacamole is delicious.
author: Grant W.

description: I think this guy was a manager or supervisor but he was giving great customer service while training someone and made my friend and I feel welcome (:
author: Jazmine F.

description:
worst chipotle I've ever been to and I've gotten food poisoning at a different chipotle. twice. this place is still worse and here's why:

-its takes 15m for the line to get from the door to the register 
-once i FINALLY got up to the register (I only wanted chips and had to wait in the whole line) the girl at the register let me know they had none and i'd have to wait for ten minutes 
-i wasn't offered anything as an apology which is like really cuz i just wasted my whole lunch in line for NOTHING

i'd walk to another chipotle, you'll get your burrito faster
author: Chessie C.

description: This Chipotle is in the heart of it all so they tend to get you in & out pretty quickly. I know they raised their prices overall so being in the middle of the city, this is probably the most expensive Chipotle around but it is what it is.
author: Leina K.

description:
The worst Chipotle I have been to. 
The staff were nice enough but the rice was hard and not fully cooked, the guacamole was old, the onions and peppers were burnt. 
The entire place was dirty and the drink/utensil station wasn't well stocked. 
I won't be coming back to this location.
author: Denise A.

description: Chipotle started going downhill once it started charging customers an extra $3.50 for a quesarito. I've been boycotting them ever since. #freethequesarito
author: Nikki W.

description:
This is easily the worst Chipotle that I have ever eaten at. The customer service was terrible, and the girl at the counter was rude to a customer and then proceeded to talk shit about that customer to me. Really? 

The food was equally as disgusting, my gf and I both got steak tacos but the broad that made the tacos was too lazy to reach behind her for a fresh batch of steak that we got the scraps from the bottom of the barrel and my tacos - since I ordered second - had literally 4 pieces of steak on them which was threw off the salsa to steak ratio making my tacos inedible. But that's not the worst part, because the worst part happened when we went out for drinks. 

THE SHITS. The shits all night and the shits all morning. That is apparently what you get when you get the scraps from the bottom of the barrel.
author: Chris B.

description: Am not impress with this particular location because the food portion is small compare to a lot of Mexican food.
author: Nuhc N.

description: Don't get me wrong, Chipotle tastes amazing. HOWEVER... I ended up with explosive diarrhea x10000 for 3 hours straight and my bum is now recovering. If you want to save yourself and the people you care about and your butt hole I suggest you go to the Chipotle by the Metreon. The Chipotle over there is always clean and you don't see any cross contamination of the foods.
author: Allison K.

description: Chipotle is cheap and tasteful fastfood restaurant. Healthier than burgers. You should have quick lunch also dinner.
author: Onur T.

description: We ordered 2 salad bowls the beans,meat, and rice were cold. The meat was too hard and chewy and contained more fat then actual meat. The sour cream was runny and the salsa had no flavor it was just straight spicy. The prices for their items are over priced and not worth it at all. Their food isn't even real Mexican food so they shouldn't be called "Chipotle Mexican grill". They had bad customer service they tried charging us double then What we ordered and charged $4.00 for an extra little scoop of meat. Chipotle will never see our faces in here again and best believe I'm letting everyone I know, know about this place and the horrible food they serve. P.s chipotle doesn't even deserve one star for a rating.
author: Julius L.

description: I dontnunderstand why people complain. The line is not that slow, the prices are cheap and the food is healthy and nice.
author: Simon B.

description: Super slow process with too many employees standing around.  It seems like a simple fix but is a regular at most locations.
author: Joseah R.

description: Omg where do i begin we get there and half there food is gone!! Nasty ass leftovers rubbery steak no tortillas and gave us food im stupid bowls with dried up veggies.. So disappointing.. Btw they were closinn in 20mins
author: Cici G.

description:
Tried their new "sofritas" today and found it to be really good! Its a pretty yummy vegetarian protein that tastes awesome and goes well with all the other chipotle ingredients.
After 6 happy years together, I had grown somewhat bored of Chipotle, but this spicy new ingredient gave our relationship a new lease of life!
This particular outlet of chipotle is also one of the better ones! It gets a lot of the tourist crowd and is pretty small, but they seem to be really efficient and polite now matter how crazy the lines and orders get.
author: Aditya M.

description: With chain restaurants like Chipotle, you can assume that food quality should be consistent for the most part. This location is not an exception; the burrito bowl is still highly addictive. Today, it appeared to be extraordinarily busy with the line creeping out of the storefront. The service was friendly, but then I noticed why the line was so long. A couple of new employees were being trained on the line and were a little generous on their food scoops, hence the admonishment by the manager, hence the long line and wait. I'm all for more generous scoops of food - MORE CILANTRO RICE AND CHICKEN FOR ALL!!!
author: Mike L.

description:
I frequently have lunch at this location. Its recently remodeled, very clean. Most of employees are nice and doing their best to help you.
However, assistant manager Terra was not helpful at all. Recently the store had some technical problems with the cashier register. By mistake they overcharged my two cards. 
When I got to the store to get the refund, and brought the proof that I was overcharged, instead of an apology for the inconvenience, she basically told me: that I need to contact my bank to get the refund. Seriously? 
So to get my own money back I had to file a claim. And she - a manager. - simply could not refund me.

Still no even apology from them for overcharging and the inconvenience! That's not customer service, Terra!


But everyone else is very nice. It can be very very busy during lunch time, but everyone is doing their best. I still eat at this location:)
author: Dimi N.

description: Can't go wrong with Chipotle when you are at Union Square and want a decent burrito. The staff is always kind and you are in and out. It can get a bit crowded so keep that in mind if you want to dine and dash and continue with shopping.
author: Marie P.

description:
Love this location!  I usually get a salad or burrito bowl.  Had the chicken burrito bowl today with extra lettuce and it was delicious!  I like it with both the corn salsa and the spicy salsa.  It's a great meal for $8!

This space it not all that big and can get crowded for lunch so plan come earlier or later.

They keep it fairly clean but come on folks, bus your own tables.  You're walking by the garbage can on your way out the door!
author: Susan C.

description: Decent food, fairly priced. Obviously it's still fast food, so at peak times you'll be rushed, the tables could be cleaner, etc. I like it for the option to eat fairly healthy, tasty, and low-carb on the go (obviously if you skip the flour tortilla).
author: Antonio C.

description:
Been here the last two nights and enjoyed the food.  Big burrito stuffed with barbacoa, brown rice, black beans, salsa, sour cream and cheese! Guacamole is $2 extra...tasty but not worth it.  Burrito by itself is $6 and well worth it.  

Good spot to people watch - burrito in one hand, beer in the other.  Make sure you pick up some napkins as it can get messy.  Pacifico Cervesa is my beer of choice here, $4.50.

Will be back again as it's just down the road from my hotel!
author: Timmy R.

description: My first Yelp review because I've been consistently annoyed (after several visits) by this Chipotle, which lowballs you and gives you the smallest amount of portions possible. The food itself tasted fine, but quite honestly they easily give you well over 30% less food than any other Chipotle I've visited. I'll now be telling people I know at work to avoid this location.
author: Chet H.

description: Not sure what to say... just your average Chipotle Mexican Grill.
author: Gary L.

description:
Better than the one at the mall! That one kinda sucks. But this location has great portion sizes, good service and cold beer. When they're super busy you can tell everyone is on point and knows what to do. 

My advice to hungry patrons is to know what you want. Once you get to the counter, the other hungry people will look at you like starved zombies if you hold up the line deciding if black or pinto beans are better.

But overall a decent Chipotle location.
author: Erica J.

description: Skimpy on everything, very overwhelmed with customers walking in the door, not focused on person in front of them.
author: Jason K.

description:
Chipotle ROCKS!!  I know it's not totally authentic Mexican food - it's California style which means it's a little healthier for you, and it's all GOOD!  They awarded us a free burrito after participating in the Great Urban Race last weekend, so we couldn't pass it up.  

We had gone to other locations in San Jose before,  but this was our first time to the Union Square location - I often forget about it because it's just off of Powell and I'm usually rushing past it off to *somewhere*.  Well, after enjoying our burrito earlier this week, I will certainly not forget!  

I had the chicken burrito in a bowl (love how I can bypass the tortilla, although I love it too!) with lots of salsa, rice, beans, bbq chicken and a side of guacamole - lovely and filling and oh so yummy!  Love you, Chipotle, and I will definitely be back!  :)
author: Maile N.

description:
(See pics)

4 stars because this is reliable food in Union Square..
4 stars because it's not another diner or pub in Union Square.
4 stars because it opens until 10pm and midnight on Thursdays through Saturdays in Union Square.
4 stars because it's only $6.5 for a gigantic burrito in Union Square even there are a couple taquería places in Tenderloin but this is really good priced.
4 stars because it's not in the food court in Union Square.
4 stars because the service is not touristy even in Union Square.
4 stars because it's an easy takeout quality place in Union Square as it said on the receipt, "Gourmet without attitude".

4 stars. Burp!
author: T L.

description:
This Chipotle is newer than the one in the fidi but they are pretty skimming on the food. boo. 

I have been craving a burrito but the one I got here looked a lot smaller AND didn't taste as good as the one I got at the fidi location. I do like how they offer napkins out in the open unlike the one at the fidi location. 

That's it.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Glad to see another Chipotle open up. I came by for lunch today and got pretty much what I expected. In and out in under 10 mins. I guess people still don't know it's there or it's just far away enough from the FiDi lunch crowd. The layout here was a little different from other Chipotles. I gotta say I like the updated look.

My only problem was a minor one. The guy wrapping my burrito had no idea what he was doing. The burrito was all girth and no length (that's what she said?)
author: Cristofer P.

description:
"I wanna write 'I miss you' on a rock and throw it at your face so you know how much it hurts to miss you." -NP

The SHORT
Gringo burrito to go: mad liquid smoke rather than the real thang, but with the proper portion of corn salsa and guacamole - its pretty bang'n.  Heavy on the sodium but every order tastes exactly like the last - no surprises here.  

LONG:
Let you in on how I handle my long distance relationship: we get on the phone and agree on a place to eat, then with our headsets, drive "together" to our agreed upon destination.  Since so many places in Portland are local and unique, we sometimes will do a chain I can find in Cali like Chipotle.  Otherwise, we just order a different version of the same thing at comparable restaurants.  Sometimes, my date will even eat dinner twice to conceal what we are doing because it's that pitiful - yearning to share a meal together more than during our special trips.  

You probably think this is crazy, but did I mention that she's my soul-mate/ twin and we've been torn apart by adulthood?  She's married and I hardly ever get to see her because she's in another state with no plans to move back - ever.  Yeah, sad story, super-wack, but I love her new life and tribe -  for that I get on a plane whenever I can.  When the distance gets to be too much, we pick a spot and then tare some food up.  And we do this pretty often, even though she's a grad student w/ 4 kids, and I'm a miserable law student.  True love knows no barriers. 

FOOD
I personally like their burrito bowl w/ chicken, black beans, cheese, sour cream, guac, corn salsa, no rice.  The other R-sita always orders barbacoa all the salsas and sour cream.  We both get it to go, then eat together in our respective cars. 

Obviously, I miss my R-sita dearly right now - having tele withdraws since both in finals [I turned my phone back on but she left hers off] hence the excessive Yelping.  While it might be a minute before we do it again, I will never stop going to Chipotle for a gringo burrito/bowl to go.  Even if we become neighbors again, we are going.  Been going hard for 11 years.  Not just because it's another public portal for us to connect, but it is good enough to stop time.  This is where my co-dependence starts and ends. 

NOTE:
And if you see a girl who looks like me in Portland eff-ing up a juicy barbacoa while on her cell, might be my girl getting more than a gringo fix.  Don't bother her - she's likely on a "date" with me.  I need it.    

TIP: 
If you have an iPhone, you can download an app to place your order.  Also the ones by college campuses hook you up with a free drink after you flash a student ID.
author: Rayna A.

description: I am a chain food lover because I travel a lot so Chipotle is usually a thumbs up but this place was dirty. No one was bussing, the soda machine was out of ice and there was urine or water on the bathroom floor and toilet seat. Eeww
author: E.R. P.

description:
I like Chipotle. It's tasty, they have brown rice, they're fast and they're on my way to work every day. All these are plusses when I stop in here to grab a bite to eat on my way to work once a week.

However, this Chipotle - out of the 5 around Downtown San Francisco - is the worst hands down. Yes, they're fast.

But all too often theres just one person making the food while 4 or 5 others are clustered around the register BS'ing. Too often I've seen lines grow like wildfire while one or two overworked Burristas(?) thrash out the grub.

And the customers! Every day there's some idiot holding up the line who thinks their order has to be some gourmet confection that winds up being crammed inexpertly into a torta, no matter what.

And the worst part... and I've eaten at all 5 Chipotle locations - New Montgomery, Market, Metreon and the Mall, and this one - this one will often give me the worst, the most violent, and sometimes the most painful BMs.

If only the food wasn't so damn tasty.

Two Stars, and a call to the Health Inspector in the morning.
author: Tim T.

description: THE WORST chipotle I've ever been to. I went there last night and ordered a salad with sofritas, and the server gave me an extremely small portion, maybe because there wasn't much left. The portion was clearly much smaller than the rest of the orders' servings. I asked for more, and he said he'd have to charge me more. I wasn't in the mood to argue with a. Line behind me, so I left it. I took it to go and realized when I got home that the server didn't offer me beans or anything else on my salad. I basically just paid $7 + taxes for lettuce and salsa. I wish I remembered the server's name so I could call him out on his terrible service.
author: James T.

description: Brown rice bowl and mix in all that you like. Totally customisable so caters to all t  Best of all its an extremely affordable gluten free option. This is my go too for a late night snack in union square if i don't want thai or noodles.
author: Pilar M.

description: Horrible service. You tell then what you want and they ignore you and put other stuff on it. You ask for a little,  they give you an overflowing spoon full. When you ask them to fix it,  they glare at you and use their hands to pull it off. I come here a lot because it's the only decent tasting Mexican food near my work,  but this happens EVER time. Train your workers to listen please.
author: Kate V.

description: I agree with whoever said that Chipotle is the best fast food burrito chain. It's basic, but it's fresh and reliable.  Going anywhere in Union Square area during the Christmas shopping season is a hassle, but they went through the line fast, and I was in-and-out in less than ten minutes with a hot fresh burrito.
author: Dana G.

description: The tall, female worker who made my burrito here was extremely rude.  Not going back here again.
author: James C.

description:
I love me some Chipotle (+1 star), and I abhor this location.

The service is unfriendly.  The neighborhood is sketchy.  Parking sucks.  It's the slowest fast food I've waited for in a long, long time.  And not one but two employees incorrectly wrapped my friend's burrito before inexplicably giving up and handing it to him.  FAIL.

The experience almost ruins the flavor of the food.  I said almost.  I still inhaled my Barbacoa Burrito like it was the last supper.  But in the future, I'll just go to other locations.  Any other location at all.

At least there's a kickass cupcake shop across the street...

Avoid.
author: Brendan S.

description: Busy place no where to sit but a great place to get your fix then leave! This place is busy & high energy workers that are fast & friendly too
author: Lani A.

description:
Tasty, fast, cheap, and probably the healthiest of any fast food Mexican rest.

I notice that the burritos are always rolled a little 'un-traditional'

Other than that, I have to say its wonderful!lll!!!!!!!

This is also a great location!
Its located right next to The Starbucks off of Powell.

yum yum yum yummy
author: Ash R.

description: I just got back from Cabo and am already craving chips and guacamole! Chipotle is pretty decent and did the trick!
author: Nelly M.

description:
Consistent Quality for Lunch!

I'm admittedly a regular at this Chipotle location now - mostly because it's one of the closer options for me for lunch and there aren't that many good options in the Union Square area which are not "touristy". Give me my burrito bowl with brown rice, black beans, chicken, fajitas, and top it off with salsa, corn, cheese/sour cream and a lot of lettuce and INSTANT lunch.....all for under $8.00 :)

The service is fast and the food is consistent here!

It's good fast food which somehow does not seem like fast food at Chipotle and its all about location location location for me here!
author: Lisa M.

description: Don't get me wrong I love Chipotle.. I get the chipotle craving probably once a week, and I never get sick of eating it! This location is the worse Chipotle I've ever walked in to. The staff is not friendly, and the workers do not listen! I came in before the rush, and the line was not even that long. They were rushing so bad that they did not even ask me what I wanted in my burrito. I told them I wanted the salsa in the individual to go containers.. because I was going to commute and I didn't want the food to go soggy, but they just put it all in and than wrapped it.. I couldn't even get a chance to say anything...Also the food here.. probably the worse Chipotle I've ever had. Veggies were mushy, and the rice was disgusting... Also these workers did not know how to wrap a burrito.. all my food fell out of the tortilla.
author: Eleana H.

description: Typical Chipotle chain location.  This location is not extra clean, but it does offer more seating area than many other locations.  Lines are separated from seating area, which is a plus because who likes a bunch of people shuffling around while eating???
author: Chi T.

description: This location has the same quality of food as other Chipotle locations, which is pretty good.  I got a salad here and everything was good and fresh.  I thought they were a little chinczy  with the lettuce compared to salads I've gotten at other locations, but everything else seemed about the same.  They are in a pretty busy location and I could seem their small location being pretty full at times, but when we were there it was pretty quiet and there was no problem getting a table.  There's also a new Chipotle at Metreon, which I'll have to go check out some time.
author: Scott L.

description:
The chicken here is kind of dirty and a little sketch.

But I love the pork. I'll be back. (Especially for those chips and guac. Yes.Mmmm....)
author: Joel G.

description:
Let's be honest - People love Chipotle not because it's authentic Mexican food, but because it's in a category of its own. Just like Panda Express. You don't go to Panda Express to get Chinese food, you go to get "Panda Express" food.

I'll have my cravings for Chipotle once in awhile and this location is super close the my new office. We go about once a week, although I really don't know why other than the fact it's Chipotle. This location is by far the worse one I've ever been to (including a ton on the FiDi area, San Jose, Seattle, etc). I literaly witnessed one employee scolding and yelling at another employee while they were working on my order and the portions are so much less tha other locations. Sure, most Chipotles serve up enough to feed two, but you still don't want to feel like you've been completely robbed of your Chipotle meal.

Unless you really are just having a bad craving and this is the closest location to you, I'd suggest taking your $8 somewhere else.
author: Angela S.

description:
I just had to review this specific location after the staff amazed me. It was late, I was hungry...Chipotle caught my eyes, as it was a place I was familiar with. The place wasn't busy when I came in and I happened to be indecisive on my order. Thankfully, the staff was really cool and invented something on the spot for me... A Quesaburrito (basically a burrito with the cheese pre melted, as if it was meant to be a quesadilla beforehand).. they charged me the price of a regular burrito, but I have to hand it the staff for giving me the best experience ever, out of all the Chipotle locations I have been to. 

The food was great, but the service was what made this place special. Honestly, all other locations should strive to be like this one (and their employees should be given a raise too). Hopefully I can visit this one again.
author: Robin D.

description: This location seems to have a lot of turnover. Sometimes the new employees don't know how to limit the amount of food they scoop into your bowl, but sometimes they limit it to the extreme! I get the vegetarian bowl and it is very inconsistent. They often run out of syrup in the soda fountain. It wouldn't be so bad if it were just one type of soda, but it is typically four different sodas at the same time.
author: Amber S.

description:
I am a die-hard chipotle fan. When I  asked if I could get a little extra rice usually they say sure and give you another spoonful.  I could count how many grains of rice of they gave me extra, terrible. At this place, they were stingy on filling the burrito.

I go to chipotle to eat an extremely unhealthy meal! I want that extra rice and sour cream. Of course, I want that extra cheese added as well! That's why i ordered a double-wrapped burrito! But when they can't oblige my cravings for a ridiculously huge burrito that is then  a "food baby" i can't see myself returning. But i just love chipotle so much and this is the closest one, so i kinda have to come here

The one over on New Montgomery is way more generous! Learn from them!
author: Steven C.

description: The person who scoops our food is very stingy. Gave us very little chicken. Somebody asked for more chicken, but he got upset and said that if he scoops more, he's going to start charging more. Other than that, this is your standard chipotle place. You can get a bowl or a burrito. Choose your meat and topping.
author: Erni L.

description: I am definitely a chipotle lover. Docking this location 1 star because they didn't have hardly anything besides salsa one night. Even though it was close to closing time they should have planned accordingly as the place was still packed and coming.
author: Melanie P.

description:
usually I love chiptole but this place had horrible food.

1. burrito was hard and stale
2. rice was overcooked and many pieces were hard as rock.
3. the lettuce was clearly old it looked slimey. I was wise enough not to get it.

visited on jan 4th around 630pm

really such a bad burrito.
author: Rob B.

description: This place gets 4 stars because it is your standard Chipotle and serves good food at a reasonable price. People giving this place one or two stars because they ran out of forks, or bowls... it happens,, especially at a place like this. The staff there has always been friendly and I go here ALOT so I would know, and the place always gives me extra rice and beans if I feel they haven't given enough and I ask for it.     Omggg Chipottleeee, Chipotttleeee is myyyyy lyyyfeee.
author: Robert H.

description:
Great food - healthy choices abound (or not so, if that's what floats yer boat). Friendly staff. Great location. Cheapest healthy food for miles around.
Can't miss!
author: Chris E.

description: Chipotle is always good but I was surprised how uncrowded this one was.  The seating had a good layout and it never felt crowded.  They move the customers fast so four stars.  Hard to do in the Fog City.
author: John P.

description:
I agree with all the other yelpers who are complaining about the stingyass portions!!!! I was on lunch break and i knew there was a Chipotle nearby so I decided to go here. 

I got the steak bowl and when she was serving me the rice she gave me one stingy little scope, i know that is NOT going to tickle my tummy!! I asked for more rice and she put like 1/4 of a scoop of rice, ARE YOU F-ING SERIOUS?! STINGYYY.

And the steak, OMG prolly like 10 pieces on there TOPS. I know some people are about portion control, but come on at least let me pay for my money's worth. I don;t know what kind of training these workers have gone thru, but they have no knowledge on how to measure how much to serve obviously.
author: Alice Z.

description: Confirming what I feared was an aberration. The steak salad is amazing. I do it with no dressing, and just use salsa instead. Everything is super fresh and tasty. I used to go because it was handy if I was near Union Square, but the last two trips were just to go there (well, and to Cako across the street). A+ for quick, easy and delicious.
author: Robert M.

description: Decently cooked meat and preparation is expedient. cashier could use some help. If you get a burrito expect it to explode at any given chipotle. Get the bowl n keep it carb free and clean.
author: Nadeem Y.

description:
Che-pot-tel (LOL, inside joke)

But yes, Chipotle, me likey.  I'm kind of excited that Chipotle opened up a few years back around this area.  Working in downtown for over 7 yrs, you need something new.  I'm so not used to having rice and beans in my burritos but I had to get used to it moving to the bay area.

Burritos:  Skimpy on the meat, but at least its cooked all the way, the barbacoa is the bestie.

Burrito Bowl:  My fav, ask for HELLA gucamole. =) yum!!!

Salad:  It's pretty much lettuce with all the burritos insides on top.   gr8!

Chipotle, you're good in my book.

Disclaimer:  Lines get long pretty much all day, but they opened up another one in the mall. shhhh!  Order with the Chipotle App and it's ready in 15 mins, just come in and pick up.
author: Edrian D.

description: So I love Chipotle.  It's quick, healthy and tasty.  Sometimes I day dream about it.  So today when I found I would have time to run out for lunch, it was the first thing I thought of.  So I'm standing in line ordering and I look up and the guy making my food has sweat poring down his face dripping everywhere.  It's totally disgusting.  Where is his hat?  Why was that ok?  Anyway, I walked out.  No way would I ever want to eat my burrito bowl with a side of sweat.  Is the $3 extra too?
author: Charles S.

description:
OMG! When you talk about Chipotle, I will always sayy YES! I am deeply in love, I always get there Burrito Bowl, and also have a Tortilla on side, so I can make my OWN fajitas...gosh typing this makes me drool...

But, I do have to admit in their bowls it depends whose serving you, because it can be stingy size...so make sure you WATCH & ASK for A BIT MORE! :) I love their customer service there too... 

Their Barbocoa is an option if you guys are tired of steak...[its still beef], and always will be my love is the CHICKEN! ;) I hope this helps...After having a Chipotle 3 BLOCKS from my place...when I want a burrito I just go hit CHIPOTLEEE! 

Chao! 
Jenn
author: Jennifer B.

description: This Chipotle is by far the worst one in SF, I definitely would not go to this one if you live in SF.  It's pack with tourists and the burritos are way smaller here...Also we once ordered online here and they forgot to check their machine for our order, so we had to wait, no biggie, except that when we got our food we were missing salad dressing, missing salsa and my burrito was the size of a taco.  I'm not one to write crappy reviews but this place sucks big time.
author: christopher h.

description:
STAY AWAY!!!!

first and last time at this place. ordered a burrito. everything was half a scoop, a pinch of cheese and a pinch of lettuce not to happy already.

 then while eating, i see the the jack*** make a burrito bowl for another person. and it was stacked up high like a freaking mountain. to the point where things were falling off the top and onto the counter (im referring to a giant scoop of guac)  before even getting to the cashier.

also very unprofessional. employees yelling to other workers in the back. and people yelling from the back to the front. 

hate this place stay away. unfortunately i dont see this place closing down anytime soon. they should close down or at least hire some new workers that are not retarded.
author: Lawton K.

description:
Shitpotle. I came up with this while sitting on the toilet. And then my co-workers said, "Everyone says that," but agreed. My ingenuity a failure, I sought comfort in knowing that we collectively regretted our lunches, but yet we come back. Yeah, I need to get out of this tumultuous relationship.

On a brighter subject: They play very nice music. There is an uplifting song by LCD Soundsystem titled "Someone Great" and my boyfriend and I had a special moment when it was playing. "Useful Chamber" by Dirty Projectors totally took me by surprise. So, my compliments to Chipotle.
author: Peter H.

description: I'll make this quick. No secret menu items (nachos quesarito, etc.) will be made here. They don't drain the sofritas, so halfway through your burrito, the juice comes leaking out of the foil all over the place, pray you didn't order to go. After they make the smallest burrito I've ever seen from a chipotle, feel free to grab it yourself from behind the counter and put it in your own basket because they don't. I don't expect this from chipotle. Bad form.
author: Richard M.

description:
This location is by far the worst I have ever been at. I have been to many locations nationwide and yeah, this one is disappointing. The portions are half the size of, the employees like to yell at each other in front of you, and apparently they don't know how to fold a burrito ( it took them about 3 tries to get a mediocre fold in there) 

I do have to say,  though, their flavors areas good as any other chipotle but the experience and comfort factor are lacking.
author: Carlos M.

description:
Let me begin by saying I loooove Chipotle. Yes, it's not legit Mexican, and that is exactly why I love it. Chipotle's lime cilantro rice beats the orangey red rice any day. I'm pretty weird. Anywho, my ultimate craving is a spicy chicken burrito bowl with lots of corn, cheese, guac and lettuce. All my other experiences were at the Walnut Creek Chipotle, as it's close to school for me (SMC). Yum yum.

HOWEVER, this particular location sucks balls. First off, the way this Chipotle is constructed makes the line awkwardly crowded, so that you're just kind of shoved off to the side the moment you walk in. Not only do they totally rush you here, they completely skimp on your food. I got literally HALF as much food in a burrito bowl here than other locations. I was still hungry after finishing -- that was super weird for me. You totally don't get your money's worth at all; what a disappointment. Lastly, the place is effing gross. Hella scraps on the floor and the tables are definitely not clean. Not a pleasure.

The only reason this place gets two stars is because the flavors are still good.

Eh. Worst Chipotle I've ever been to.
author: M J.

description: Great location -- open late; til 10 pm.  Just a hop, skip, and jump away from the major Union Square area.  Gotta love it!
author: Mel G.

description:
Chipotle seems to be pretty consistent across the board, but this one stood out.

1) They DO skimp on the food
2) My chips were hella salty... I couldn't eat much of them
3) There are two doors... ENTRANCE and EXIT. I sat by the exit door and apparently, there are either a lot of idiots who come through here who can't read, or this location's layout isn't that great

Mmmmm.... I think I'll skip this Chipotle next time.
author: Carolyn N.

description:
Being a Denver native, I grew up on Chipotle. When I moved to San Francisco about 5 months ago, I was excited to try all the Burrito options the city has to offer. I have tried a lot of burritos but I still get nostalgic for a big fresh burrito from Chipotle. I was told 2 days ago that there was a Chipotle by my school downtown so I had to go check it out.

I walked in excited for the burrito that I have come accustomed to since I started going to the first one in Denver about 15 years ago. The fresh lime cilantro rice, sauted fajita veggies and clean refreshing Guacamole, YUM. They proceed to make my burrito and my heart sunk. They put so little filling on the tortilla that I had to say something. They told me that they only put in one small scoop of rice, beans, and veggies. I asked them to put more and they did, which I appreciate. The woman (she was new) had trouble rolling the burrito even though that was the average amount of filling that I have had at any other Chipotle location. This place has not gotten their burrito rolling art mastered. All of this would only knock of one or two stars for me because I would hope the food would redeem my experience.

Upon going to pay, the manager (I think) gave me a lecture on why they under fill their burritos and why what I got was not standard to them. She said that she has heard a lot that they put less than other locations and they use a different standard than other Chipotles. I am not a big fan of being lectured to when my expectations are not met, but I still had my burrito, and it was going to be great.

First, the rolling was sub-par so everything mushed out as I ate. Rolling of a massive burrito is an art they have not mastered. It also did not help that they over heated the tortilla and it became crunchy, not stretchy. Inside, the rice was good as well as the beans and guac. The veggies, however, were mushy. They have always been crunchy and fresh tasting, but these had none of the qualities that I look for. As I sat watching people get their burritos, I saw many people walking away with something of a size that should embarrass the founder of Chipotle. 

I have loved Chipotle for years (except the few when McDonalds owned them) and this will not stop me from going to other locations especially in Colorado and everywhere else I have had great burritos. But please do not judge all Chipotles based on this one location. The rest deserve your love. This one, not so much.
author: Peter V.

description:
I hate the fact that as much as I love the food that I had this experience. I ordered my food online like any other usual time because my lunch is so short that I can never go and stand in line and order my food there. I went and picked up my order and went on my way. After returning to work to eat my food, I opened it to find my order was incorrect. They had added something that wasn't even on the order sheet that they use to prepare my order. I was going to let that go by and then I continued to eat and I found a SCREW in my food. Yes that is correct, A SCREW. I called frantically and told them. They told me to bring it back in.

When I brought it back in all they did was give me a refund for my food and then COMP burrito bowl. NO APOLOGIES or anything as if I had ordered the screw with my food. NO LONGER GOING TO THIS LOCATION!
author: Aeeshah D.

description: I had a Chipolte binge last summer but it has stabalized.  I recommend a chicken burrito with brown rice add guac and sour cream with the hot sauce on the side - light cheese.
author: Anthony B.

description:
This was a great Chipotle. We ordered it online a block away from our hotel, so by the time we walked there our food was ready.

When you order online you have to type in your name for the food, so I wrote "Kellee!" with an exclamation point and they included that on the foil when they wrote my name. It was a really cute surprise when I opened the bag, which just added a lot to how friendly they already were. 

We ended up eating inside, and I watched them handle a line of 20+ people like a BOSS. Seriously.

The burritos were HUGE. They were generous with the guacamole, too, which is something I get happy about because you pay so much extra for it. All the ingredients had great flavor here and the cheese, I noticed, had a bold/sharp flavor to it. 

Hooray for this Chipotle!
author: Kellee N.

description:
I LOVE CHIPOTLE!!!! I dont think any location has ever been less than a 5 star. There is the occassional mishap or missing item... but i have tried several options and love them all... my fav is the buritto bowl, however, please note you can ask for more rice, beans, salsa without any extra charge! (extra meat and guac is extra!) but everything else... get wild! 

Since this location is in SF, there is limited seating, and it is packed! for lunch time rush!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I love love love Chipotle! The only reason this location did not get 5 stars was because of their portion sizes! They barely put anything in their bowls. They food was great like any other Chipotle, they were just stingy. 

The seating is also very limited here, but it's in San Francisco, so I wasn't too surprised by that.
author: Amy D.

description: I'm not quite sure what all the bad reviews about this place are:  We were craving chipotle and this was a solid choice.  Quick and friendly service, clean store, and $7 burrito in an area full of really over-priced food.
author: Robert C.

description:
I was standing outside of this restaurant with a group of friends.  We were starving at 10pm and trying to find a place where we could eat and drink alcohol.  The pink-hair manager heard us talking and invited us into her restaurant, promising we would all get free guacamole.  Her superior customer service didn't stop there.  Once we all got our food, she came to our table to ask if we wanted more drinks, and checked on us several times to make sure we were okay.  She was really, really good.  I hope she gets a raise!
The food was standard Chipotle; if you're a fan, you will not be disappointed, but the stars are for the great service.
author: Gina C.

description:
Terrible experience all around

They missed my online order.. Ended up waiting an extra 28 minutes for the to go order in person.

When I went to the front of the line to pick up my to go order, the portly girl with glasses ignored me as well ...and didn't even apologize when screwing up the orders

Owner/mgr was at least nice and offered a drink for the misshap

Not coming back . Ever.
author: Bobby B.

description:
Dear Chipotle, 

Welcome to the hood! You finally made a grand appearance today, and I was there to greet you. I admit, I'm slightly embarrassed to say I pretty much checked up on you every week when I found out you were going to settle into the neighborhood. Embarrassed? I guess truth is, I'm not at all that embarrassed. I'm proud to scarf down a whole giant burrito to myself- don't judge! 

For a very busy opening day, the restaurant seemed quite organized. Slightly chaotic, but there were plenty of workers frantically jumping around. Despite the lunch crowd, the workers were very welcoming and friendly. The restaurant is slightly small, but very cleanly designed! I like the industrial look, with very interesting rows of tables and lights. 

Now the best part? Ordering online or through my iPhone app!! 6 burritos, and 15 mins later-all I had to do is go up to the take out window to pick it up. My order was a bit behind, but I forgive you guys- opening day is stressful! Thank you for slapping on a sticker with the corresponding name to each burrito!

I'm an occasional sucker for chain joints like you, and I admit that I enjoyed the meal a lot. The burrito was a bit sloppy in structure, but hopefully this is perfected. The barbacoa (shredded beef) was full of flavor and tender! I like to top my burrito off with corn salsa & a little hot salsa (it has a bit of a kick!). For extra charge, guacamole can be added. So a typical burrito cost me about $10-a bit more costly than a taqueria, but I forgive you. 

Thanks Chipotle! I'll probably be seeing you soon! And like you said...

Life is Burritoful! ;)
author: Catherine O.

description: This is the WORST Chipotle I have ever been to, and quite possibly the worst customer service experience I have ever had. All of the people there were SO rude to my father, who is older and cannot hear very well, just because he asked for clarification when ordering. They gave us so much attitude, the service was absolutely horrible, the food was not up to par with other Chipotles I have eaten at, and there were about 10 seats in the whole restaurant, so my family had to eat separately. I am disgusted by this location and won't be eating at Chipotle for a long time.
author: Katherine W.

description:
Another Chipotle restaurant, another 5 star review! 

I can't get enough of their chicken burritos. I crave them often. And now, I don't have to walk a mile to get one! 

I am very happy that Chipotle opened up just 3 blocks from work. I took 2 of my coworkers here today for their grand opening & now I have them hooked, too! 

Yay for overstuffed burritos!
author: Erin S.

description: I have been coming here for months and I never had a problem. I love the burritos but dislike the price. I think that the food is worth it. Lines are not as long as I usually think they are.
author: A K.

description:
I totally love Chipotle and been going to it for ever. This one opened up not too long ago and had good experiences until today. 

STINGY portion. I had to ask multiple times to add to my meal so that it's not child sized. They were out of a lot of things and the person helping me asked for my order more than 3 times before he remembered what I said. 

Could be better. Very disappointed and still hungry.
author: Carolina T.

description: Not much taste to any of their food items, would go there if there were no other options available but again not tasty at all and loaded with a "jack" tasting cheese unless you tell them to hold back. Have tried their bowls & burritos, so plain...
