author: Beth P.

description: Ordering a big lunch for our office and they told us that "they are too busy to cut up the burritos in half. The order was for $300 worth of burritos...wow what a service..isn't what they are supposed to do there.
author: Lourdes A.

description:
I'm glad they opened a Chitpotle near Powell station because the Montgomery location was full of Fidi arrogant patrons! This was my third visit to the O'Farrell location and simply always satisfied. I waited in a steady moving line and when it was my turn to order a sweet guy greeted me with a smile.  

I got a vegetarian bowl:
cilantro rice, extra black beans, grilled onion and bell peppers, no cheese, and guacamole. I will definitely come once a week for that!
author: Billy T.

description:
Yum Yum Yum!! 
It is so so tasty, I had the veggie wrap.  Their guacamole was so tasty, the best I have had in a while.  The veggies tasted fresh and it was a big wrap. 
The drinks are free refill which is great for something that rarely exists in England.  It was quite busy but the queue went down quite quick. 

I've had the Chipotle in London and the quality is just as good.
author: Susana P.

description: The food was served to me a little bit cold and the people who make the burritos weren't that nice. The rice that I had was as hard as a rock. There is usually a super long line at this location. From now on, I'll just go to the other Chipotle a few blocks away that is a whole let better
author: Paul B.

description:
After six year of living in Phoenix it's hard to get really excited about chain Mexican food. However, Chipolte is always a good option when you are looking for cheap yet good quality very Americanized Mexican food. 

Pros
- Price
- Fast
- The Guacamole!!!

Cons
- Not very authentic
- They don't have a true Salsa Verde! And the only mild salsa is Pico. Not a fan.
author: Marissa P.

description:
This is the best Chipotle I've ever been to. 

I mean, let's get this out of the way first: it's Chipotle. You know the food isnt going to make you cream your pants or anything. It is, though, going to make you think about it when it's not around and more likely than not make you go out of your way to get it in your mouth. Rawr.

Food aside, the atmosphere here was way fun. I ran in at 9:45 or so on a Wednesday, worried I wouldn't make it before close, and there was a line almost out the door. Annoying? Not at all. Jovial and convivial and festive. There's an energy in that neighborhood around that time of night (especially in the summertime when the tourists are all out and about) that this Chipotle embodied charmingly. 


Really though, the thing is this: I could not BELIEVE how awesome the staff here were. I order this really funky thing there (no details necessary, just, you know, imagine 7,656 grams of carbs in a cardboard bowl with an aluminum lid) and I almost always have to coax the person behind the line to make it right. It only has two ingredients, so it's not very laborious, they just don't seem to want to believe that I'm really asking for what I'm asking for. Not the case with this girl. She was ON BOARD man! She took me seriously right off the bat and made it just right,  and laughed at the silly wiiticisms I am apparently compelled (at mental gun point) to launch at servers or other food professionals I interact with. 

I bought a small drink, and the cashier (a different woman) just gave me a large cup instead gratis. She explained: "Because we're just cool like that." 

You sure are Chipotle on O'Farrell, you sure are....

P.S. Fine! Stop bullying me! I get a Burrito Bowl with nothing but rice* and corn. God!

*or, as I always say when I'm ordering it a "shit ton" of rice
author: Devin F.

description:
This is a fancy fast food chain place for a burrito or tacos!..  Decent price for a decent size burrito, but I would rather get a burrito bowl!  This location is a dent size with bar seats and table seats.

I order the burrito bowl, it comes with choice of cilantro-lime rice, pinto or vegetarian black beans, meat (braised caritas or barbacoa, adobo-marinated and grilled chicken or steak) or guacamole, salsa and cheese or sour cream.  They have roasted vegetables that you have to ask for, (grilled onions, peppers)  then you can ask for a side of flour tortilla or tacos for free and make a small taco or use the flour tortilla to eat with burrito bowl

Overall this place can be busy, but the line goes fast so it shouldn't be that bad of a wait.  The only thing I was a bit upset was that they were kind of skimpy on everything in my bowl.  It wasn't topped of as how I usually get it.  I told the person "can I get a little extra" several times and I guess he did not get it that he wasn't serving enough!!!  By the way you will get more with the burrito bowl, than getting a regular burrito!!!

-Parking-
This is another location parking can be difficult, if you are shopping around downtown by Powell and O'Farrell street, then this would be a decent pit stop for food.
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
A bit skimpy on the goods, but the flavors seem to be the same as its contingents. 

Better stick with the chicken as the carnitas were fatty.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
My order:  2 carnitas tacos
Food comments
Corn tortilla - rich full flavored but COLD.  Only one tortilla per taco was used.  Two tortillas per taco is appropriate.    Grade D
Carnitas - flat; no robust carnitas flavor; COLD.                                          Grade D-
Brown rice - acceptable.               Grade C
Mild salsa - tomatoes had no flavor; onions tasted like fruit (?); tiny specs of cilantro; no interesting zesty spiciness.           Grade F
Only one time have I ever had a worse carnitas taco.
Overall grade for 2 cold tacos      Grade D-
Service comments
Food was prepared quickly.
All of the employees were black and were unsmiling, grim faced, and above all UNCARING.  It was abundantly clear from my brief interaction with 3 employees that they were UNCARING.  There was no friendliness.  Your order is prepared behind a counter according to what you ask for at each food prep. station.  I had to ask for more salsa.  The employee never asked me if I wanted more salsa.  Because all food is behind a counter I did not get as much salsa as I wanted.  They act as if they are giving you food with an eye dropper.
Overall summary.    Food: D-    Service: F
I was angry and disappointed that I paid $6 for 2 cold tacos.  It was an inferior meal.  I am 100% certain that I will NEVER come back to this Chipotle Restaurant.       N E V E R
author: Gene R.

description: I do not hate myself for eating here. As person who tries to stick to a whole-foods, plant-based diet, this was to me a perfectly good option for grabbing some rice and beans, and although I'm pretty sure there isn't a single chipotle behind the counter, it was fine. And the people working were friendly.
author: Klevin D.

description: I've visited this chipotle a few times with great results, but this past weekend was the worst! The staff gave half the normal portion of everything! My burrito bowl didn't even top the bowl itself & that was with lettuce! When asked to 'put just a touch more we were told 'my boss is watching me', low and behold her boss was watching her like a hawk...if you want loyal customers to stay loyal-give them a reason to come back! I will not return to this particular chipotle. I think you  should give people what they pay for!
author: Blaqk W.

description: I love chipotle, but I don't recommend eating at this location. I've been a few times and for some reason their ingredients aren't as fresh. The staff is also not as well trained and are a bit slow with orders.
author: Alice J.

description:
It doesn't matter which Chipotle I go to I can't handle their Boca Steak.

Don't get me wrong, I think all Chipotles are clean and stuff its just I can't do their Boca Steaks!! (But if others have had this experience then, ummm, maybe we need to sound off on this then...)

But otherwise I love their bowls more than anything, makes a great satisfying meal and hardy!!! 

You can pretty much have them put anything on them anyways. Although the price...I guess makes sense since its all organically grown. Plus the price you're getting for it is enough to get you full.

Cleaniness is an entirely different matter. All Chipotles are seem to be in a chaotic mess but NOT to the point where there's rats running around just bits of food everywhere is all, not a lot.

Minus the Boca Steak and the cleaniness I like Chipotle!!!

[UPDATE]::chill-e-lax, its just food!! Boca is just simply short for Barboca, people know what I'm talking about when they get there. Isn't really that big a thing ...I don't think so, at least, but you seem to think otherwise....
author: Holden L.

description:
Chipotle is by far the best fast-casual burrito chain. I waited in line for the opening of this new location and was rewarded with a free t-shirt and gift card. The fact that so many people showed up for the opening of a restaurant like this should be proof that they are doing something right.

This particular location was staffed by very friendly people (though they were a little shaky on the burrito construction line (chalk it up to new-store jitters)). The decor seemed nice, even for a Chipotle. I'll definitely be stopping in again next time I'm stuck shopping in Union Square.
author: Aaron H.

description: This is the worst Chipotle I've been to and I love Chipotle. It seems as though no matter when I come, they have a mixture of two things: 1) items that look like they've been sitting out for too long like dry chicken and 2) empty canisters of items that have sold out and have not been replaced like guacamole. They just can't seem to get their operations straight. Someone should show them the six sigma way for goodness sake.
author: Susan V.

description:
I love chipotle - I've always gotten huge burritos full of awesome meat and guacamole.  but this is a cheap-ass chipotle.  They skimp out on the portions and when asked for more, they want to charge an additional ~50% over the price.  I've not been to the other nearby ones, but I would try to avoid this one and go to the others.  I've never been at one that has skimped out as much as these guys do.

I've noticed other people have had the same complaint so it's not just me.
author: reza n.
Torrpedo T.

description:
Chipotle was a great addition to the O'Farrell/Powell St. corner. It used to be the Union Square Pub and I was never a big fan. 
Now that Chipotle has moved in, I can tackle my midday taco craving! 
Although Herbert's Mexican Grill is just around the corner- you can never have too much Mexican food! 
I gave Chipotle a try yesterday and was surprised at how many others had the same idea I did. 
The interior is nice and there is actually quite a bit of seating both inside and out on the patio. The only downfall with the patio is that it is on O'Farrell and if you know the street well, you are aware of all the foot traffic. 
The food is really good, fresh and surprisingly pretty large. The portions are good and for $6.50 you can get a really lunch!
author: Janell D.

description:
I am a fan of Chipotle, but this location seems to lack the quick service like most other locations, especially compared to the impeccable Market Street location. 

But nonetheless, still a fan!
author: Yelp F.

description: I love Chipotle because it's like going home.  I visited the Union Square Chipotle during a business trip.  I had a very long and stressful day and was hungry....a bit pissed...and just wanted to relax.  I didn't want to drive anywhere, nor did I want to fight to get a cab....so I walked around and found an old friend...Chipotle.  I got my brown cilantro rice, black beans, and chicken, with verde salsa and sour cream... and it was just as good as the location near my home in San Diego.  Very nice!
author: Misti R.

description:
I had such high hopes for this place. The store is new, and the same for the employees so, they need more 'practice'. 
My first experence was poor. I always get Double rice, and Chicken, etc. I got one!! scoop of rice, and chicken. I still had to pay for double. I would rather walk 16 blocks to Montgomery to get my exact order rather than nothing.
Hopefully 1-3 months everything will be better?
author: Nathan M.

description:
The reason I'm not giving this place more stars is because I had a case of burrito envy.  I was so hungry, craving a burrito, and didn't want to have to venture all the way out to the Mission to do so (on a side note, somebody please share with me where you can get a Mission style burrito in the Union Square/Nob Hill area or is this just a pipe dream?).

There wasn't anything wrong with my burrito with a side of chips and salsa.  They all were very good and what you would expect from Chipotle.  Their salty lime seasoned chips are always nice.  I appreciate them telling me the pinto beans have bacon and if that's a problem.  Bacon a problem?  Made my decision easier!

The problem I had with this Chipotle was in the assembly line there were two people on each side of me whose burritos appeared to be at least a 1/3 larger than mine.  Not fair, size does matter when it comes to burritos, especially when you are hungry!  I would have expected more consistency from the McDonald's of burrito makers.
author: eugene c.

description: I eat here at least once a week and have found the food to be very good.  However, the thing that I find remarkable is the good attitude of the staff especially when the line is long. Good food, great staff, and a clean eating environment keeps me going back for more.
author: George F.

description: I give them 3.5 only because they don't satisfy my San Francisco burrito cravings, you San Franciscans know what I'm talking about, this aint no Mission Street Burrito! But for what it is, very juicy, flavorful Barbacao meat! Fresh ingredients! Minus a star, why do we need to purchase chips and salsa?? I hate you for that. Also very pricey for a burrito.
author: Karen T.

description: Pretty much your typical Chipotle.  I got the chicken burrito bowl.  Something that I haven't experienced at Chipotle's in Chicago is the crunchy layer on the outside of the chicken.  This was full of flavor and a nice surprise.  It was a nice quick meal on the go.
author: Joel G.

description: You may have to ask your server to add extra portions if you want to get a typical bursting-at-the-seams Chipotle burrito here (they sometimes skimp on portions, depending on who is serving you). But they've always been happy to add any extra anything I ask for.
author: Eric I.

description:
Hey, for a big chain I am definitely impressed. It isn't authentic mexican, but it isn't supposed to be. Fajita style burritos!?! Awesome!!

This place is seriously like mexican-style sushi. Not that anything is raw, but the wrapped up meat, rice, guacamole, etc. definitely reminded me of a sushi wrap. Radically different taste, but still delicious. 

Overall, this is a quick, easy and tasty place to fill up and save some money. Good prices, especially considering the centralized location!
author: Adriel S.

description: It's close from my work. Love the burrito bowls. The line gets too crowded but I guess.
author: Nadav M.

description:
I go there systematically for my vegetarian burrito bowl - you do have to clean up your place (seat and table) but food is consistently simple and good. And reasonably priced.
Do not expect anything fancy - just a bowl filled with fresh, good ingredients which make up like a bean based salad, music and a generally youthful ambiance.
I have to say that I am not a fan of food chains, actually this is the only one I use, but their food is so simple and so good, you can't go wrong...
author: VIORICA C.

description: Had HUGE chicken burrito filled with ingredients, tasting as a burrito should taste. Decent price for its size. Liked it.
author: Jason N.

description: Delicious all around, especially the chips & guacamole and of course the steak burrito :)
author: Erin W.

description: Thanks to a trusty giveaway burrito/bowl from a Giants game, I got to pick up at this Chipotle, which is so inconveniently not located close to the Richmond District. In any case, place looked ok, and food was mediocre.  I do recall Chipotle being better for some odd reason.  But here's a win: Borbocoa shredded beef is a nice change in my burrito from the usual carne asada.  Corn salsa is also a nice plus.  In any case, Mission burritos beats chipotle by a wide margin.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Chipoltle has a good salad bowl. I order it with the carnitas (shredded pork) meat instead of chicken or beef. 

Good fresh food.  Fast service. Good portions, no issue here.

Bought the extra guacamole and had it added to my salad. I always ask for chopped cilantro on the top of everything, and it has never been an issue. I eat at this location several times a year.
author: My T.

description: i know chipotle isn't "authentic" mexican food but it sure does hit the spot!  this is one of the places i always try to hit up when i'm on the mainland.  love that you can get mixed meats (great for those of us that are indecisive) and the corn salsa is THE BEST.  :D
author: Sara H.

description: Chipotle is the greatest! It has brought about a burrito renaissance. So fresh, so fast, so delicious.
author: Justin P.

description: great fresh food, worth it going if you have dietary restrictions
author: Jonathan F.

description: so i never have the time nor money to talk or take vacations, but I feel like I got a thirty minute break in Mexico when I come here. Authentic foods from far away lands that make my tongue dance. Watching my weight so got a "burrito bowel" it was good and had lots of spicy goop on it. if you like ethnic fair this is for yoU!
author: Merland S.

description: Meh... I love having this around the corner from my house, but the last two burritos I got have been cold. I need my Chipotle HOT!
author: Josiah M.

description: Why does it takes 4 people to make a burrito?  Staff were slow and insecure of what they were doing. Food was cold and insipid. The guacamole was like a paste and with no seasoning was so ever. Sitting space is limited and can get cramped. Sorry but this is not a place to enjoy a real burrito!  I see it as a place for tourist thinking they are eating the real thing!
author: Hum V.

description: Chipotle!!!!!! i cant believe there is a Chipotle in San Francisco. I wish i knew earlier. Love the chicken burrito
author: Eva L.

description: Good fresh food.  Fast service.  Nice alternative to the burger chains.
author: Karl R.

description: I thought Chipotle would just be like any other chain restaurant and not taste that good but I was actually surprised to find that Chipotle is pretty good . The chicken bowl is very good ... the chicken is super yummy . Never had such yummy chicken at a Mexican restaurant . I think the only thing missing is a salsa bar like Rubio's .
author: Eileen L.

description: The food here is always good, and the best part of this place is that all their meat is from non-abused animals, and they're paper products are from recycled material. All the meat burritos are excellent, and it's great that you can add corn in them, a perfect component to add sweetness that compliments the spiciness.
author: Xavier G.

description: Unable to get into Katana-Ya after hours of shopping, we accidently came across Chipotle.  We ordered salads and were pleasantly surprised at the freshness.  This is a much needed inexpensive, healthy and quick alternative in the price inflated Union Square district.
author: Arlene C.

description:
clean healthy tasty food:  after walking all day long, very tired and hungry.  the food here totally satisfied us.  $15.00 for 2 dinner. how could you not be happy? 

i had vegetarian bowl - super. next time i would order without bell peppers.

employees were cheerful, and never expected fast food employee would come to us to make sure everything is all right.  bonus customer service!
author: Little D.

description: Everything is good about this EXCEPT that they don't put enough rice when you get the bowl. Hopefully it was just that time I went.
author: Devy E.

description: I've only been to this Chipotle once, and it was while I was waiting to get my iPhone 4. I'm a big Chipotle fan from way back, so don't get me wrong, this is a good place to get a cheap burrito in most towns. But here in San Francisco you can get way better stuff from any burrito truck for cheaper. This Chipotle is new, but definitely not anything special, and I actually prefer the one on New Montgomery.
author: David K.

description: My first time to try this chain. It was fast, good quality and clean. I don't really look for much more from this sort of establishment, and these guys delivery a perfectly serviceable fast taco or burrito.
author: Mark G.

description: Been a long time fan of Chipotle. Not the best burrito but still pretty good. I like the chicken burrito with the hottest sauce. If I could take their rice and put it on any burrito I ever got, then I would be set.
author: Wes K.

description: It is Okay fast food Mexican.  I'm glad they added this location Down Town, I can walk here from my place on Nob Hill.
author: matthew s.

description: Are you kidding me?  It may have been inspired by Tacaria's around here in the Mission district, but it is far inferior in every way and I am even from Denver way back when and lived a block from the original.  Yucky!
author: Joseph F.

description:
I like Chipotle. Like Starbucks or MacDonalds you know what to except and sometimes that is exactly what I want, no surprises.   This is the first time I have encountered a problem with this company.
  I like Chipotle"s  salads because of the dressing. Without the dressing this is a boring salad, good but boring.  With the dressing it is a really good salad.  Today, at this location only, they didn't have any dressing, Zero, and with no idea when the dressing would be ready.  I was willing to wait five, ten, even fifteen minutes for the dressing but I was told by two workers that there wasn't any dressing and none forthcoming any time soon if even that day.  I might have been ok with this except that they were half way through making my salad when I was told, halfway, my daughter's salad being even further along then halfway.  Oh, and before that revelation, they didn't have any brown rice although it was coming, soon, but obviously not soon enough for my order.  
When in the service business, and especially the food service business, it reflects poorly on a brand to run out of items that are on the menu, especially items that make them unique. And it reflects on management when the customer isn't shown some sort of humility, like a coupon for 10% off or a free drink then and there. 
I will not be back to this location.
author: Danyle J.

description: This Chipotle location is great! The staff is friendly, the service is quick, and the food is consistently delicious.
author: Lauren Y.

description: This is the stingiest Chipotle I've ever seen despite costing more than others. Their burritos probably weigh about 1/2 to 2/3 as much as an average one anywhere else and let's face it you go to Chipotle to get a (fresh and tasty) gut-bomb.
author: Mike L.

description:
horrible. my first (and last) experience in a chipotle.
the only thing i knew about it was from that restaurant show on food tv. had high expectations but:
1. salad inedible due to a large quantity of tabasco prepoured on it (and i'm from new orleans)
2. hard tacos soggy and nasty
3. furniture bolted to the floor prison style. I could have accepted that since I am an architect and appreciate the industrial style - if their architect wasn't inept and unable to properly size the furniture. I am slim but tall and could not for the life of me fit in between the bolted on table and bench... just ridiculous.
4. they have sidewalk seating - great when the weather is nice. but you can't drink the beer you bought with your food when seated outdoors, at their own tables, supposedly due to some city ordinance??? either the chain (mcdonalds from what i hear) or the city - are inept.
5. 6 people in line takes 20 minutes. just ridiculous.
6. they need to buzz you in if you go to the restroom. really???

so buh-bye chipotle, not sorry you're not in my town. you would never make it in new orleans anyway.
author: Vlad G.

description: love Chipotle!! the burritos are great.. prices are reasonable.. very busy during lunch hours.. overall its great..
author: RICHARD W.

description: So I have to say that this was the WORST experience I've had at Chipotle...and I love Chipotle; but not this location. My husband and I are on vacation from Miami, so we are used to rude people; but the lady assembling the orders takes the cake!  After a long day of walking we were starving and decided to get food here.  I ordered a salad and was looking so forward to eating it, when I got to the register I asked for salad dressing; the lady at the assembly line that took my order overheard and told me they were out of dressing; I apologized to the cashier and told her I no longer wanted the salad...what is the point of a salad with no dressing.  The assembly line lady very rudely said "for future reference, ask us if we have dressing first, that way we don't have to make the salad".  First of all, I have never been to a Chipotle that has run out of dressing (i go once or twice a week). Second, she is the one that works there and knew they were out of dressing... To her I say this: For future reference, if someone asks for a salad and there is no dressing, let that person know... Chances are they will change their order and you don't have to make the salad! LOL! So rude!  My husband and I walked out laughing in pure disbelief that she had the audacity to say that to me; like if it was my fault... Horrible customer service by assembly lady... The cashier was nice.  Will NEVER go there again!
author: Marcio C.
